title: Sync frontend type bindings for Player.role field

requirements.summary: Update generated TypeScript bindings/usages so the frontend compiles after `Player` gains a required `role: string` field, without any UI or behavior changes.
acceptanceCriteria: TypeScript compilation succeeds after the backend `Player` type changes.
No new screens, components, or visible UI changes are introduced; the app renders and functions as before.

file_operations.description: Regenerate or manually sync the frontend type bindings so `Player` includes a required `role: string` field (not optional), matching the updated backend candid/types. Ensure exports used by the app (e.g., `Player`, `RoomState`, `backendInterface`) remain compatible and no UI text/behavior changes are introduced.

If TypeScript errors surface due to the updated `Player` type flowing through `RoomState`, apply minimal type-only adjustments (e.g., import/type fixes) to keep compilation passing without changing rendering, screen routing, or any user-facing text.
